definition: generic term for birds and animals/birds/to capture (old)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: These birds should also not be used for animal feed.
sentences.chinese: 這些禽鳥也不應用做動物飼料。

sentences.english: The zoo has about 800 birds in all.
sentences.chinese: 該動物園總共飼養了大約800只禽鳥。

sentences.english: The migration of the virus has set off fears that flocks in Europe soon could be infected.
sentences.chinese: 病毒的擴散使人們擔心歐洲的禽鳥很快會受到感染。

sentences.english: Government warning. Stay clear from birds and never feed them.
sentences.chinese: 奉政府諭，切勿接觸或喂飼禽鳥。

sentences.english: Birds bit its parasitic it wood, and woods which.
sentences.chinese: 禽鳥銜其子寄生它木上，便鬱茂。

sentences.english: Every birds bird is oviparous, and it is viviparity however.
sentences.chinese: 凡禽鳥都是卵生，而它卻是胎生的。

sentences.english: Local agricultural authorities also found evidence of H5 infection in household birds.
sentences.chinese: 地方農業部門也發現了家養禽鳥中H5感染的證據。

sentences.english: Ducks are a type of water fowl.
Most recently, H5N1 also has been detected in birds in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 最近，在俄羅斯的禽鳥中也發現了H5N1型病毒。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
(bird species of China) red-crowned crane (Grus japonensis)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
